title: Education & Experiences
section: The Role of hydrogen peroxide and L-lactate in the interaction between streptococci and Aggregatibacter actinomycetemcomitans
text:
The Role of hydrogen peroxide and L-lactate in the interaction between streptococci and Aggregatibacter actinomycetemcomitans
Lewin Lab, CWRU | Center for Global Health and Diseases, Department of Pathology | 2025 - present
I study the metabolite-mediated interactions between the Streptococcus genus and the oral pathogen Aggregatibacter actinomycetemcomitans through an in vitro biofilm coculture model.

title: Education & Experiences
section: Youth in Transition: From Juvenile Courts to Adult Systems
text:
Youth in Transition: From Juvenile Courts to Adult Systems
Under supervision of Dr. Jill Yang | CWRU Social Justice Institute | 2023-2024
This is a statistics-based research regarding Ohio’s legislation on juvenile offenders transfer policy from juvenile criminal system to adult criminal system using data from the Cuyahoga County Juvenile Court.

title: Education & Experiences
section: Comparative Study on Environmental Education in Guatemala and Japan
text:
Comparative Study on Environmental Education in Guatemala and Japan
Independent project for Environmental Systems and Societies, IB | UWC Costa Rica | 2022-2023
I examined the impact that different educational methods have on environmental awareness among students. Collected over 500 data points based on student and educator surveys in different Guatemalan and Japanese educational institutions.

title: Hi! Thank you for passing by my webpage!
text:
Instagram
  
  
    
     LinkedIn
  
  
    
     Email
  




Hi! Thank you for passing by my webpage!
I am Hana Sato, a third year undergraduate student at Case Western Reserve University (CWRU) in Ohio, USA. I am a biochemistry B.S. and political science B.A. candidate. For my biochemistry degree, I have concentrations in infectious diseases and structural and computational biochemistry. For my political science degree, while not a school-official concentration, I have placed emphasis on taking courses about international politics.
Beyond my school courses, I have also been engaged with research. From my first semester at CWRU until my third semester I worked as an undergraduate researcher under the supervision of Dr. Jill Yang, then a post-doctoral fellow in the CWRU Social Justice Institute. And starting from my fourth semester at CWRU, I started working as a researcher in the Lewin Lab, a microbiology lab. I greatly enjoy asking big questions and actively work hard to answer them. Because of this, I am interested in applying to graduate school programs to ultimately obtain a PhD degree. My interests lie on global health and epidemiology, where I will be able to participate in both wet lab experiments as well as computational analyses.
Outside of academics and research, I enjoy film photography, spending time in nature and helping people to learn Japanese and/or Spanish! Having Japanese heritage while being born and raised in Guatemala, I value cultural diversity and awareness. I often find myself wanting to share about my cultural heritage as well as listen to other people’s cultural backgrounds.
Again, thank you so much for visiting my webpage!
Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or simply would like to chat with me!

title: Hobbies and Interests
text:
Beyond academic and research work, I enjoy finding new hobbies. Since little I have loved reading, and lately I have acquired more interest in non-fiction books. Encouraged by a friend, this year I started taking photos with a Kodak Ektar H35 film camera and I have enjoyed it so much! While I wouldn’t count it as a hobby, I am a very picky eater and I am in love with yummy food. So I usually spend big chunks of my days cooking meals. I will take advantage of this space to show off some of my best recipes!

Film photos!
